taskbody.context: Warning: Keep mineral spirits off all rubber and plastic parts of the typewriter such as the platen, feeder, or paper-bail rollers to prevent damage

step.cmd: Lift the ribbon cover into an open position.
Re-package your cleaning solvent into a small bottle with a precision applicator or liquid dropper top.
Apply solvent to any areas of visible grime. Focus on parts that move a lot, such as the type basket, segment, and udercarriage
Use a soft-bristled brush, such as a toothbrush, to gently scrub the areas where the mineral spirits have been applied.
Take a lint-free rag, or cotton swab for hard to reach areas, and remove excess mineral spirit and loosened debris.
Apply mineral spirits to the end of the type slugs, focusing on areas with stuck-on ink.
Using a stiff-bristled brush, gently scrub where the mineral spirits have been applied.
Remove excess mineral spirit and loosened debris using a cotton swab.
step.info: If ink or debris remains, use a toothpick or cleaning pick to gently scrape it off the type slugs.

step.cmd: Set the typewriter in direct sunlight, or in front of a fan, for a few hours to a couple of days to fully dry.
